title: Lifecycle Bootstrap: Local-First Instruction Strategy
body:
Purpose: Provide early lifecycle guidance after bootstrap confirmation (or implicit activation in existing workspace).

Agent Action Model (post-confirm or existing workspace):
1. Add only minimal, local, high-signal instructions (P0/P1).
2. Before adding, query via instructions/dispatch (actions: list/search/query) to avoid duplication.
3. Monitor 'instructions/health' (recursionRisk should remain 'none') and 'bootstrap/status' (confirmed stays true).
4. Promote instructions (priorityTier bump or export) only after usage stability (low churn, multi-session usage, cross-category relevance).
5. Use feedback/submit for anomalies, improvements, or drift signals.
6. Avoid embedding tool catalogs—use dynamic discovery (tools/list, help/overview).
7. Reference mode (MCP_REFERENCE_MODE=1): treat catalog as immutable; do not attempt mutations.
8. If confirmation ever needed in a derivative workspace: bootstrap/request → bootstrap/confirmFinalize.

Promotion Signals (all strongly suggested):
- Repeated multi-session invocation.
- Cross-team or cross-scope applicability.
- Stabilized wording (few edits across time).

Never embed secrets, credentials, or volatile configuration. Governance markdown remains outside runtime catalog.
semanticSummary: Lifecycle and promotion guardrails after bootstrap confirmation
